page.title: 18LAND USE
page.content: The{land use}in this area is mostly for farmland which is sown and fertilized grassland. Large tracts of woodland are in evidence, much of which is{coniferous}forest planted during the past sixty years by the Forestry Commission with a view to replacing timber cut down in the First World War. Some woodland, however, is not maintained for commercial reasons, and appears unmanaged. Footpaths through such woodland areas provide delightful leisure facilities. A large area of land was once used as a{race {course,}but horses have not raced there for over a century. Nowadays its use is as a popular recreational locality for walking. Many field gates to had been made by an old method of using tree_trunks ,instead of using metal and wooden plank .
